intro: Pabstiella pandurifera, commonly known as the golden bell orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that resemble small bells, which bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The botanical significance of Pabstiella pandurifera lies in its unique floral structure and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
